title: Kinfolk Magazine Font - spread
content:
What Sans Serif font is used in this spread? I really like the combination between the sans serif and serif font.  
I'm looking for the font used in " instant extraction" in the image below. And if one can tell me what Serif font is used in the sentence "Spotlight on......Tokyo" I would be so greatefull!

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304203534im_/http:/typophile.com/files/kinfolk_magazine_japan_tokyo_lou_mora_little_nap_004_4477.jpg)
author: alekspietrzykowska

comments.content: As it's definitely too small for my eyes, I'd only risk very common ones: [Trade Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304203534/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/trade-gothic) Condensed Bold (or [Alternate Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304203534/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/alternate+gothic)) and [Caslon](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304203534/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/caslon) Italic
Whats the sans font used for "coffee"?

Here's a closer look at another article from the same magazine. This should help to better ID the serif. Definitely looks like some Caslon to me as Ryuk suggested.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304203534im_/http:/typophile.com/files/kinfolk-copyblock_6626.jpg)

I know this is a little late in replaying, but after checking out whatthefont there's definitely a match for Adobe Garamond Pro. Here are some of the results:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304203534im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202015-01-17%20at%2011_4989.21.37%20PM.png)
